address: Xã Yên Hợp, Huyện Văn Yên, Tỉnh Yên Bái
thought:
**Analyzing the Administrative Shift of "Xã Yên Hợp"**

My task is to pinpoint the new administrative unit for the old address "Xã Yên Hợp, Huyện Văn Yên, Tỉnh Yên Bái."  I began by focusing on the province, "Tỉnh Yên Bái," and quickly realized I needed to account for any potential mergers.  My knowledge of these administrative changes pointed me toward Resolution 60-NQ/TW, which confirmed that "Tỉnh Yên Bái" had merged with "Lào Cai" to become "Tỉnh Lào Cai."

With the new province identified, I shifted my attention to "Xã Yên Hợp."  The next logical step was to scrutinize all available resolutions, primarily focusing on those related to "Tỉnh Lào Cai" (or resolutions that might still use the old "Tỉnh Yên Bái" name if they predated the merge).  Scanning these documents, specifically looking for "Yên Hợp," I found Resolution 1673/NQ-UBTVQH15.

This resolution was a key find.  It explicitly outlines the merging of several wards, including "Yên Hợp," into a new ward called "Xã Xuân Ái."  This resolution perfectly aligns with the change of province to "Tỉnh Lào Cai," confirming that this is the correct match.  Furthermore, a direct search in the "New wards" data yielded the entry:  `{"ward_code":"04441","ward_name":"Xã Xuân Ái","province_name":"Tỉnh Lào Cai"}`.  The match is perfect.

To be absolutely certain, I ran a quick check of other resolutions containing "Yên Hợp," just to ensure no potential conflicts.  The other resolution I found, 1678/NQ-UBTVQH15, mentioned "Yên Hợp" but was related to "Tỉnh Nghệ An," so this was a clear dismissal.

Therefore, the only valid interpretation is that "Xã Yên Hợp" is now part of "Xã Xuân Ái" in "Tỉnh Lào Cai," with high confidence given the clear resolution and confirmation in the new wards data.  The key citation supporting this is the specific line in resolution 1673/NQ-UBTVQH15 which names the merge.

citation.header: 1673/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Lào Cai
citation.line: 21. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Đại Phác, Yên Phú, Yên Hợp, Viễn Sơn và Xuân Ái thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Xuân Ái.
